0.name: The Pyramid Maze
desc: "   You are standing in a sandstone room.  The floor is covered in a very
fine sand.  The walls are smooth and the ceiling looks like the same un-
remarkable sandstone.  There are some hieroglyphs on the walls.  Maybe
they are important?  Footprints lead east.
A stone slab drops and blocks the exit back west!
Uh oh!
You study the strange hieroglyphs intently...
|       v       |       v
You wonder what they could mean...

100.name: Entrance to the Labyrinth
desc: "   You are standing in the entrance to the Labyrinth.  Above you the
steps upon which you descended look very inviting.  To the west a stone
corridor stretches off in to darkness.  You strain your ears to listen
but all around you is silent.  The corridor is 10 foot wide by 10 foot
high.  At a guess you measure the walls, floor and ceiling to be made of
massive  blocks of granite.  The blocks have been so well made that they
fit seem-lessly together so that only the merest hairsbreadth of gap
exists.  They are also smooth and cold to the touch.  The floor is clear
of any dust or debris.  It would be impossible to tell if anything has
passed through here recently.  You can exit up, back out of the Labyrinth
or west and brave any perils the may lay ahead.

101.name: Inside the Labyrinth
desc: "   You are standing at a junction between two stone corridors.  Each
corridor is 10 foot wide by 10 foot high.  At a guess you measure the
walls, floor and ceiling to be made of massive blocks of granite.  The
blocks have been so well made that they fit seem-lessly together so that
only the merest hairsbreadth of gap exists.  They are also smooth and
cold to the touch.  The floor is clear of any dust or debris.  It would
be impossible to tell if anything has passed through here recently.  You
can exit east and south.

105.name: Inside the Labyrinth
desc: "   You are standing at the junction of two stone corridors.  You notice
immediately that the walls here do not meet exactly with the floor and
that there is a seam that runs directly down the centre of the solid
stone floor upon which you stand...  There is a creak!  Dare you move?
You can exit south or west.
There is a clanking and whirring of machinery.
The floor judders beneath your feet.

180.name: The Throne of Skulls
desc: "   You are standing a massive chamber that has been painted in what looks
like an off yellow colour...  But on closer inspection you see that the
walls, floor and ceiling are actually made of thousands--no, millions!--
of skulls.  In the centre of the floor stands a massive chair made of the
same skulls as the rest of the room.

and glyphs.  There is an energy in the air here that speaks of a terrible

be a good idea to move?  You can exit north or south.
Suddenly all the runes and glyphs flare to life!
You realise your mistake...

209.name: The Solar Room
desc: "   Bright light fills this large room.  Looking up you see you are stand-
ing under the glass dome of a massive chapel.  In the dead centre of the
room is a large altar that has a cross-hatch patten around the bottom.
Looking closer you can see something inside the altar, through the cross-
hatches of white marble.  You get an ill feeling.  Something evil lurks
very close...  You can exit back through the plain wooden door to the
south.

212.name: Inside the Labyrinth
desc: "   You are standing in a stone corridor 10 foot wide by 10 foot high.
You immediately notice that the ceiling is a latice work of cracks and
crumbling masonry.  You edge foward slowly.  Dust and small lumps of
granite dislodge themselves...  You suddenly notice the floor has a seam
running directly down the middle!  TRAP!  Get out!  Get out now!  You can
exit north or south.
Several boulder-sized lumps of ceiling fall!
They hit the floor with a thump that makes the room judder!
Should you be here?

217.name: The Sandy Chamber
desc: "   You squeeze through the hole to find yourself inside a dark and sand-
strewn room.  The walls and ceiling are made of tightly connected blocks
of sandstone that offer no exit...  Wait a minute!  No exit?!  Uh oh!
Looking around frantically you see that you have been left with no exits
out of the room.  Where has the hole gone?!  What magic is playing with
you?!  In the centre of the room a steeply slanted staircase leads down
into the sandy ground.  As you near the base of the stairs a low pitched
moan echoes around the chamber.  Your eyes dart back and forth, vaguely
you see some scribbled writing on a single block, but your eyes are drawn
back to the stairs...  Chances are, your way out is down there.  You can
exit down, in to the sandy darkness.
"The Scarab is the Key" - M.

ceiling to be made of massive blocks of granite.  The blocks have been so
well made that they fit seem-lessly together so that only the merest
hairsbreadth of gap exists.  They are also smooth and cold to the touch.
The floor is clear of any dust or debris.  It would be impossible to tell
if anything has stopped here recently.  There is a hexagonal opening in
the wall to the north.  You wonder if there is something interesting to
be found through it?  You can exit back to the south or try the opening
to the north.

226.name: The Base of the Jelly Pit
desc: "   You are standing at the base of a massive tiered bowl.  The floor is
made of highly polished metal and is very slippery.  The bowl rises up
all around you.  There is a another tier around ten feet up, but the bowl
slope is such that a quick run up will get you to that next level without
too much hassle.  You can see another tier beyond that.  The ceiling has
the look of a liquid and you realise it is actually dripping on you... A
soft, gelatinous liquid.  It doesn't appear harmful.  But it does make
you ponder the strangeness of this place.  Finally, all around, on every
tier, are strange jelly-like creatures.  What is this place?  You can
exit up to the next tier or north back in to the Labyrinth.

233.name: The Frigid Depths
desc: "   You are standing in a freezing cold chamber.  Your breath fogs in the
air before you; a testament to the extreme temperature.  The walls are
covered in frosted ice.  Icicles hang from the ceiling.  Below you a trap
door leads down in to a bright crystal tunnel.  You had better wrap up
warm if you're thinking of going down there!

desc: "   You are standing at a junction between two stone corridors.  Each

247.name: Heroes Final Fight
desc: "   You have reached a dead-end in a stone corridor.  The corridor is 10
foot wide by 10 foot high.  At a guess you measure the walls, floor and
ceiling to be made of massive blocks of granite.  The blocks have been so
well made that they fit seem-lessly together so that only the merest
hairsbreadth of gap exists.  Here the walls are pock-marked and covered
in scratches and blast marks.  It looks like someone built barricades
here at some time in the long distant past and that a mighty battle was
waged in this very spot.  Sitting sadly in the corner is an skeletal
figure dressed in shining battle armour that is so old it has fused to
the sad little corpse inside.  On closer examination you see the armour
is covered in scrapes and scratches and looks like it has withstood the
might of an army.  It is a shame that it is impossible to remove from the
corpse now.  The corpse itself is positioned in such a way that it looks
like its finger is pointing to some oddly logical scratches on the wall
next to it.  Whoever this was they were a hero.  You feel humbled to be
in the presence of such a one that evidently took on an army and held out
for a long time.

extra.keywords: wall scratch scratches mark markings marks logical
desc: BEWARE THE JADE PALACE

268.name: Prison of the Colossus
desc: "   You are standing in a circular chamber with a pit in the centre.  From
here you can see the head and shoulders of a giant humanoid creature that
appears to be stuck inside the pit.  A faint blue luminescence surrounds
it.  It's massive eyes turn to look at you.  You don't feel any malice in
the stare but you do feel a power beyond anything you have ever met or
seen before.  There is a staircase carved in to the side of the pit, lead
-ing, presumably, down to the creatures' feet.  Before the staircase is a
figure shrouded in black robes and carrying a scythe. You can exit down
in to the pit or head back east in to the Labyrinth.

282.name: Around the Rim of the Leprechaun's Hat
desc: "   You are standing on a soft, dark-green, spongy ground.  To the north
of you a wall of the same dark-green substance rises up in to the gloom
above you.  Around the base of what you think is a wall is a light-green
band of the same kind of material.  Looking closer you can see a pattern
of four-leaf clovers covering this light-green band.  Looking south you
see that there is no return exit back to the labyrinth...  Instead there
is just empty blackness where the strange, dark-green ground ends, a few
feet from where you are stood.  The strange dark-green ground curves off
north-west and east.

be impossible to tell if anything has passed through here recently.  You
can exit north and east.

286.name: Inside the Labyrinth
desc: "   You have reached a dead-end in a stone corridor.  The corridor is 10
foot wide by 10 foot high.  At a guess you measure the walls, floor and
ceiling to be made of massive blocks of granite.  The blocks have been so
well made that they fit seem-lessly together so that only the merest
hairsbreadth of gap exists.  They are also smooth and cold to the touch.
The floor is clear of any dust or debris.  It would be impossible to tell
if anything has stopped here recently.  You can exit back to the east.

287.name: Inside the Labyrinth
desc: "   You are standing in a stone corridor 10 foot wide by 10 foot high.  At
a guess you measure the walls, floor and ceiling to be made of massive
blocks of granite.  The blocks have been so well made that they fit seem-
lessly together so that only the merest hairsbreadth of gap exists.  They
are also smooth and cold to the touch.  The floor is clear of any dust or
debris.  It would be impossible to tell if anything has passed through
here recently.  You can exit east and west.

288.name: Inside the Labyrith
desc: "   You have reached a dead-end in a stone corridor.  The corridor is 10
foot wide by 10 foot high.  At a guess you measure the walls, floor and
ceiling to be made of massive blocks of granite.  The blocks have been so
well made that they fit seem-lessly together so that only the merest
hairsbreadth of gap exists.  They are also smooth and cold to the touch.
The floor is clear of any dust or debris.  It would be impossible to tell
if anything has stopped here recently.  There is an icy door in the wall
to the south.  You wonder if there is something interesting to be found
through it?  You can exit back to the west or enter the door to the
south.

290.name: Inside the Labyrinth
desc: "   You are standing in a stone corridor.  You feel a proper dunce for not
moving on when you had the chance.  The light from the runes fades as you
look at them.  You can exit north or south.

291.name: Inside the Labyrinth
desc: "   You are standing at the junction of two stone corridor.  You notice
immediately that the walls here do meet exactly with the floor and that
there is a small seam that runs directly down the centre...  Dare you
move?  You can exit south or west.
The floor opens beneath your feet and you plunge into darkness...

292.name: Plunging...
desc: "   You are plummeting in to darkness.
Should you not be trying to save yourself?
Above you the floor swings shut with a CLACK!
You're still falling... This is going to be messy!

293.name: Plunging...
desc: "   You are plummeting in to darkness.
Should you not be trying to save yourself?
Crack! Ouch!! You've landed! That really HURT!!

294.name: Inside the Scorpion Pit
desc: "   You land with a thud!  You manage a quick glance at your surroundings;
You are in the bottom of a stone pit.  The walls look smooth and offer no
handholds.  You hear a clicking.  A scuttle.  You turn.  Uh oh!

295.name: Inside the Labyrinth
desc: "   You are standing in a stone corridor 10 foot wide by 10 foot high.
You immediately notice that the ceiling is a latice work of cracks and
crumbling masonry.  You edge foward slowly.  Dust and small lumps of
granite dislodge themselves...  You suddenly notice the floor has a seam
running directly down the middle!  TRAP!  Get out!  Get out now!  You can
exit north or south.
The ceiling caves in!
A thousand tons of granite crushes you!
You are dead!

296.name: You are crushed!
desc: "   You are crushed by several hundred tons of granite.
You are dead!
Oh dear.

297.name: Second Tier of the Jelly Pit
desc: "   You are standing on the second tier of a massive bowl.  Below you the
base of the dish looks all shiny and reflects the odd, liquid ceiling in
it's metallic surface.  All around on this level are jellies of various
colours, all glooping and slurping loudly as they move.  Above you is the
final tier.  The jellies look even bigger up there!  You can exit down,
back to the base of the dish and the exit to the Labyrinth.  You can move
east or west or up to the final tier.
You slip and slide down the metal slope...

it's metallic surface.  All around on this level are jellies of various
colours, all glooping and slurping loudly as they move.  Above you is the

305.name: Top tier of the Jelly Pit
desc: "   You are standing on the third tier of a massive bowl.  Below you, you
can make out all the jellies on the base and second levels.  The shiny
metallic surface glints and glistens and reflects the strangely liquid
ceiling that is now mere inches above your head.  You tentively reach up
and touch the liquid.  It is cold to the touch but doesn't appear to be
harmful.  Looking around this tier you can see some very big, very dark
jellies standing stationary in the northwest, northeast, southwest and
southeast corners.  You can exit east or west or down, back towards the
base of the bowl and the exit the Labyrinth.
You slip and slide down the metal slope...

317.name: Prison of the Colossus
desc: "   You are standing on a platform halfway down a massive pit.  From here
you can make out the shoulders, body and waist of the giant humanoid.  It
doesn't move, and the blue luminescense surrounding flickers and shimmers
in the light of your torch.  There is a staircase at the far end of the
platform, presumably leading down to the creatures' feet.  Before the
staircase is a figure shrouded in black robes and carrying a heavy, two-
handed mace.  You can exit down to the pit or head back up to the
Labyrinth.

318.name: Prison of the Colossus
desc: "   You are standing at the bottom of a massive pit.  Before you are the
legs and feet of a giant humanoid.  They are shrouded in a fiery blue
luminescense that flickers and shimmers.  On the wall is a panel of three
holes that looks very strange indeed.  Before the giant stands a figure
shrouded in black robes and carrying a hefty, two handed sword covered in
swirls and cartouches. You can exit up, back towards the Labyrinth.

319.name: Inside the Crystal Snowflake
desc: "   You are standing inside a giant crystalline snowflake.  It is so cold
in here that you're freezing as you ponder this place!  There must be a
place where you can escape this infernal cold!  You can see through the
walls of the snowflake to several other crystal branches--possibly all of
them are connected to the this one.  In the distance you can see other
snowflakes, tumbling as they fall silently through the air...  Where are
you?  You can exit southeast, southwest, northwest or northeast.

356.name: Around the Rim of the Leprechaun's Hat
desc: "   You are standing on a soft, dark-green, spongy ground.  To the east of
you a wall of the same dark-green substance rises up in to the gloom
above you.  Around the base of what you think is a wall is a light-green
band of the same kind of material.  Looking closer you can see a pattern
of four-leaf clovers covering this light-green band.  Looking west you
see that there is just empty blackness where the strange, dark-green
ground ends, a few feet from where you are stood.  The strange dark-green
ground curves off north and south-east.

357.name: Around the Rim of the Leprechaun's Hat
desc: "   You are standing on a soft, dark-green, spongy ground.  To the east of
you a wall of the same dark-green substance rises up in to the gloom
above you.  Around the base of what you think is a wall is a light-green
band of the same kind of material.  Looking closer you can see a pattern
of four-leaf clovers covering this light-green band.  Looking west you
see that there is just empty blackness where the strange, dark-green
ground ends, a few feet from where you are stood.  The strange dark-green
ground curves off north-east and south.

363.name: Inside the Leprechaun's Hat
desc: "   You are standing on some strange shaggy carpet made of thick ginger
strands that are quite soft to the touch.  Looking around you see you are
inside a massive chamber of some kind whose walls are made of the same
dark-green spongy material as the outside.  The chamber stretches off to
the west, north-west and north.  A strange, high-pitched, cackle pierces
the air...  Uh oh!  You can exit back through the tear or explore the
chamber.

desc: "   You are standing on some strange shaggy carpet made of thick ginger

367.name: At the Top of the Leprechaun's Hat
desc: "   You are standing on some strange cloudy material that looks like it
should have no substance whatsoever.  Looking around you can see a large
golden pot to the south-east.  The chamber stretches off east, south and
south-east.  You can also exit back down the rungs.

368.name: At the Top of the Leprechaun's Hat

369.name: At the Top of the Leprechaun's Hat
desc: "   You are standing on some strange cloudy material that looks like it

golden coins than you have ever seen in your life!  Wow!  The chamber
stretches off west, north and north-west.
